firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for a secure, user-centric application. The primary `/users/{userId}` collection uses the Firebase Auth UID as the document ID, creating a direct and secure link between the authenticated user and their data. This path-based ownership is the cornerstone of the security rules. For business accounts, a separate `/businesses/{businessId}` collection is used, also keyed by the user's UID, to cleanly segregate business-specific data from personal user data, simplifying rules and queries. Products are in a separate, publicly readable collection to allow browsing for all users. Customer orders are now stored in a `/orders` subcollection under each user (`/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}`). This robustly enforces that users can only access their own orders through path-based security, which is more reliable and secure than query-based rules. Notifications are also stored in a subcollection under each user for the same security reasons. Administrators retain read access across all user orders for management.
